drupalNodeEvent.title: Constructing a China: Nationalism and Culture in Modern History

field_organizers.processed: Lieberthal-Rogel Center for Chinese Studies, University of Michigan

field_description.processed: Diverging from the dominant view that modern Chinese nationalism is a product of Western-style modernization, this talk explores how the quest for a Chinese cultural identity became central to debates over political and moral values. This century-long pattern can help to shed light on where Chinaâ€™s intellectual and political life is heading.
